website_summaries.verdict: The modernized waffle maker with an IQ engineered for breakfast perfection.
pros: Customers love that it cooks two waffles at once and to near  perfection each time
12 unique settings are available to  satisfy the tastes of the most sophisticated of waffle palates
The Bit More button adds additional time to the cooking cycle
cons: Test small batches when using non-traditional recipes, as they may stick

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY waffle maker that can handle classic waffle mix to perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wonderful waffle maker, just so I can taste this new spicy chile maple syrup. I insisted to use, but to do that I had to get a waffle maker that could get hot enough to make a "classic" waffle, which is what Aunt Jamima mix--a proven brand of 128 years (!)--needs. The cheaper waffle makers really mean Belgian waffles, which are thinner and don't require as much heat. The result is perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Erol Esen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Could use a better manual.
customer_reviews.text: SO far so good. Pro: The build quality seems good, and it heats evenly. Makes waffles. Also makes delicious hash browns. Cons: The settings (buttermilk, chocolate, etc) are not explained anywhere, so there is no way to know if they change time, heat or both. THAT would be very useful to know. Also "custom" setting is not explained, and doesn't make sense- you would expect to be able to set it, right?. There are recipes in the manual that relate to the settings, but if you use different recipes you'l have to guess. It's not rocket science: just keep checking until they're done.
customer_reviews.author: PickyChick

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Waffle Maker at a Breathtaking Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great waffle maker, but it comes at a very high price. It has all of the bells and whistles, but I think some of the controls are a bit redundant and some of them like “custom” are not fully explained. Build quality is very good and there is adequate spill control. These are deep waffles so if you are using a mini waffle maker like the Dash, you will need to add about twice as much batter to each waffle section.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Mineo

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing waffle iron. What surprised me was that you don't have to wait for the iron to reheat after you've removed one batch of waffles before you pour in the next. So, its very fast.and you can adjust and fine tune the darkness or crispness to come out just as you like. And its non-stick though I use a minimal amt of oil. Easy to clean and doesn't take much space. Love this waffle iron!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne S. King

customer_reviews.title: best waffle maker ever
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this waffle maker. Makes perfect waffles. Waffles taste terrific. easy to use. Waffles are easy to take out after they are done. i like to make a double batch and freeze them for use during the week. i have made them for family and everyone loves them. i was a little hesitant to spend this amount of money for a waffle maker but it is well worth it. So far, I've been using it about once a week for a month and no problems yet. the only downside is the cleaning. Its difficult to get in the crevices but so far nothing sticks to it and its easy to wipe clean.

customer_reviews.title: Best waffle iron ever
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed on the performance of this machine. First waffle perfect , second waffle perfectly done also . At first I thought it was a yeast mix and that's why they came out so good , but next I made regular waffle mixed , put in spinach and grated cheese and diced mushrooms and got the same results. Nothing ever sticks and I haven't used a spray on it. I am so glad I invested the money on this one. Hopefully it will be my last.

customer_reviews.title: Uneven cooking
customer_reviews.text: After all the positive reviews, I wanted so much to like this waffle iron. Sadly, mine did not work well at all. customer_reviews.title: It must be the deep waffle style...

I'll be using the $39 Belgian style waffle maker from Costco that spills over and has none of the great features of this waffle maker. product_meta.title: Breville the Smart Pro 2 Slice Waffle Maker, Silver
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Newthe Smart Waffle™ Pro 2 Slice

2-slice Waffle Maker with LCD display.
Automatically calculates the correct cooking time for whatever style of waffle & color you select. Once the lid is closed, the timer and progress indicator will automatically begin to count down. LCD changes to orange to indicate cooking cycle has commenced.
feature_bullets: WAFFLE IQ: Intelligent automation dials in your cooking time to perfectly suit the style including Belgium, Classic, Chocolate, Buttermilk and the option to customize.
BROWNING CONTROL: Crisp up your waffles to your liking from light to dark with 12 different settings.
NO MESS MOAT: Waffle batter has a tendency to spill out and onto your counter top, but with this thoughtful feature excess strays are under control.
THERMAL PRO EVEN HEAT: Say goodbye to extra crispy edges and raw batter pockets. The Smart Waffle Pro distributes heat evenly across cooking plates.
A BIT MORE BUTTON: Derived from real world feedback and appearing across Breville products, this feature lets you add a bit more brown without having to restart.
NON-STICK SURFACE: Sticky batter will never stick to your cooking plates thanks to premium PFOA-free non-stick coating.
